alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Greater Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hart, west central Anderson and southeastern Oconee Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Anderson, or near Northlake, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Seneca, Homeland Park, Northlake, Pendleton, Reed Creek, Anderson Airport, Lake Hartwell, Townville and Sandy Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
